ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Really fun, insightful class that lays down a conceptual framework and context for the evolution of the immune system.

A very engaging class about evolution of the immune system. Requires a fair amount of reading as the concepts are not classical immunology but a rewarding mental exercise nonetheless. Presentations can be daunting because of the breadth of topics covered and the lack of imposed format.
I would recommend this course to another student. It helps to develop a new perspective that is broadly applicable and very helpful in the lab.
I would recommend this class. It was a good experience.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: While this course did not contribute to my dissertation/research it significantly broadened my exposure to certain concepts in immunology.
The evolutionary perspective is not something everyone thinks about and I think this class did a nice job in helping develop that view.
